info.title: Property Data V2 API Documentation
info.description:
# Introduction ## About EagleView's Property Data API provides data elements that characterize the composition and condition of a requested property. Data elements consist of measurements and classifiers that describe built structures and organic features on the property.

EagleView leverages machine learning and photogrammetric techniques to produce data elements. ## Documentation Overview Each API endpoint in this documentation consists of: - **The HTTP method.** Currently includes `GET` and `POST`. - **The base path.** The base path is `https://sandbox.apis.eagleview.com` for the sandbox or `https://apis.eagleview.com` for production. This base path is specified before the endpoint path. - **The endpoint path.** For example, `/property/v2/request`. - **Required parameters.** These parameters must be included in a request. In the previous example, `address` is a required parameter. - **Optional parameters.** These parameters can be included in a request if desired. ## Sandbox The Property Data API can be tested in sandbox mode. The sandbox testing area is limited to the following bounding box, which covers approximately 1.5 square miles in Omaha, Nebraska: ```text -96.00532698173473, 41.24140396772262, -95.97589954958912, 41.25672882015283 ``` Refer to the [Property Data API User Guides](/user-guides/developer-guides/property-data-api) for a Postman collection which contains a number of sample requests. # Authentication

post.summary: Request Property Data with Address or Coordinate
post.description: Submit a property data request by providing an address or geographic coordinates. This endpoint starts an asynchronous process to generate property data using EagleView's models. You will receive a request ID and a 202 Accepted response. Use this ID to check the status or retrieve results with the GET /property/v2/result/{requestId} endpoint. Optionally, provide a callback URL to receive results automatically when ready.

requestBody.description: The callback is a POST request with the results json payload.

200.description: Your server implementation should return this HTTP status code if the data was received successfully

get.description: Retrieve the status and results of a property data request using the request ID. If processing is complete, the entitled dataset is returned; otherwise, the current status is provided.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: ID is a unique identifier for the request in the form of a UUID4 string

get.description: Download a property image by its unique image ID using GET /property/v2/image/{imageToken}. Images are returned in PNG format. For ortho (top-down) images, you can choose to receive either masked or unmasked image. Some images may be unavailable due to age or access restrictions.

parameters.name: imageToken
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the image to retrieve

401.description: Unauthorized - Failed to get organization ID from token

example.errorDescription: Failed to get org ID from token

address.completeAddress: 694 East 6th Street, Sheridan, Wyoming 82801, United States

completeAddress.example: 10900 NE 4th St Suite 800, Bellevue, WA 98004, United States

id.description: System-generated request_id that uniquely identifies the POST request

status.description: Processing state of the request. Possible values: 'In Progress', 'Complete', 'Failure'

id.description: System-generated request_id that uniquely identifies the POST request

status.description: Processing state of the request. Possible values: 'In Progress', 'Complete', 'Failure'

lat.description: latitude geo-coordinate of the property in EPSG:4326 format, which is EGS sanitized

lon.description: longitude geo-coordinate of the property in EPSG:4326 format, which is EGS sanitized

full_address.description: The full text address of the property.  Address string is standardized through geocoding/reverse-geocoding.

line1.description: The street address of the property.  Address string is standardized through geocoding/reverse-geocoding.

locality.description: The city of the property.  Address string is standardized through geocoding/reverse-geocoding.

admin1.description: The state of the property.  Address string is standardized through geocoding/reverse-geocoding.

zip.description: The zip code of the property.  Address string is standardized through geocoding/reverse-geocoding.

country.description: The country code of the property.  Address string is standardized through geocoding/reverse-geocoding.

completeAddress.description: The address string used as input for the query.

value.description: Minimum roof condition rating of all structures on the property, excluding structures with unknown condition.

unit.description: Unit of measure for property roof condition.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for property roof condition.

value.description: Average roof condition rating of all structures on the property, excluding structures with unknown condition.

unit.description: Unit of measure for property roof condition.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for property roof condition.

E.description: Eave height measured on the east side of the structure.

N.description: Eave height measured on the north side of the structure.

S.description: Eave height measured on the south side of the structure.

W.description: Eave height measured on the west side of the structure.

unit.description: Unit of measure for eave height values.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for eave height calculation.

items.description: List of latitude/longitude pairs that draw the building outline.

value.description: Primary roof pitch (expressed as a ratio over 12), determined by the largest roof area.

unit.description: Unit of measure for predominant pitch.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for predominant pitch.

value.description: Roof shape classifier for a given roof structure.

unit.description: Unit of measure for roof shape.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for roof shape.

value.description: Primary roof material classifier for a given roof structure.

unit.description: Unit of measure for roof material.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for roof material.

value.description: Degree to which one or more trees overhang the roof.

unit.description: Unit of measure for tree overhang.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for tree overhang.

value.description: 3D roof area (in sq ft).

unit.description: Unit of measure for roof area.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for roof area.

value.description: 3D roof area (in 100s sq ft).

unit.description: Unit of measure for roof area.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for roof area.

value.description: Assessment of the roof's exterior condition. Five point ordinal scale.

unit.description: Unit of measure for roof condition rating.

reasons.description: Ranked list of reasons contributing to the roof's condition rating.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for roof condition rating.

value.description: Indicator identifying the presence of loose organic matter on the roof, generally from leaves or pine needles.

unit.description: Unit of measure for loose organic material.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for loose organic material.

value.description: Degree to which the roof covering material appears to be in a degraded state. Three-point ordinal scale.

unit.description: Unit of measure for material degradation.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for material degradation.

value.description: Primary reasons for roof material degradation classification.

unit.description: Unit of measure for material degradation reasons.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for material degradation reasons.

value.description: Degree to which the roof exhibits visible signs of natural discoloration, due to natural effects such as dirt accumulation or black algae buildup. Three point ordinal scale.

unit.description: Unit of measure for discoloration.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for discoloration.

value.description: Indicator identifying the presence of patching on the roof.

unit.description: Unit of measure for roof patching.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for roof patching.

value.description: Indicator identifying the presence of ponding on the roof.

unit.description: Unit of measure for roof ponding.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for roof ponding.

value.description: Indicator identifying the presence of a tarp on the roof.

unit.description: Unit of measure for roof tarp.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for roof tarp.

value.description: Indicator identifying the presence of a streaking on the roof.

unit.description: Unit of measure for roof streaking.

confidence.description: Confidence value (0-1) for roof streaking.

info.description: Metadata pertaining to the response payload when API is unable to deliver data. Possible values are - 'No data found', 'Invalid address', 'No building detected', 'Parcel geometry unavailable', 'ML model error' and 'No suitable imagery found'

errorCode.description: Machine-readable code that identifies the type of error.

errorDescription.description: Human-readable message that describes the error condition.
